# Course 3  Call Center Peer Review Template![][image1]

# **Scenario 1**

[Click here to listen to the call recording](https://drive.google.com/file/d/10BboHnE0zmtvaaMJlsyz8H-l1RmXGIOQ/view?usp=share_link) 

Here is the transcript of the scenario:

Agent: Thank you for calling AJTM customer support. My name is Alex, who am I speaking to today?

Customer: Hi Alex, this is John. 

Agent: Hi John. How may I assist you today?

Customer: Yes, I need to know what's going on with my prescription order. It's been over a week, and I still haven't received it\!

Agent: I'm sorry to hear that your order has been delayed. May I please have your full name and order number to check on the status of your order?

Customer: My name is John Dove, and the order number is J25416.

Agent: Thank you, Mr. Dove. Let me check on that for you. (Pause for a few seconds) I see here that your order was shipped out last Monday, but it seems to have been delayed in transit. I apologize for the inconvenience this has caused you.

Customer: Delayed in transit?\! What does that even mean?\! I need my medication, and I need it now\!

# ![][image2]

With this scenario in mind, answer the following questions:

1. Which early verbal escalation signals did you notice in this interaction? Remember, early verbal escalation signals are long pauses, short, clipped phrases, and exasperated sarcastic tone. 

|  |
| :---- |

2. Which late verbal escalation signals did you notice in this interaction? Remember, late indicators are raised voice, use of insults, or crude language. 

|  |
| :---- |

3. What could you say that would mirror the complaint to the customer?

|  |
| :---- |

4. What could you say and do that would narrate the problem-solving method to the customer? Remember to include any call transfers you need to make. 

|  |
| :---- |

5. What could you offer as a reasonable solution to the customer? 

|  |
| :---- |

# 

# ![][image2]

# **Scenario 2**

[Click here to listen to the call recording](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1tBpBA__VnJ3SE5mNHiuz2GJf7bfi6SWt/view?usp=share_link) 

Here is the transcript of the scenario:

Agent: Thank you for calling AJTM customer support. Who am I speaking with today?

Customer: Hi. This is June.

Agent: Hi June. How may I assist you today?

Customer:  I'm calling about my dishwasher. It's broken, and I need it fixed immediately\!

Agent: I'm sorry to hear that your dishwasher is not working. May I please have your name and the model number of your dishwasher to better assist you?

Customer: My name is June Smith, and the model number is KLWS-54878.

Agent: Thank you, Ms. Smith. Let me check on that for you. (Pause for a few seconds) I see here that your dishwasher is currently out of warranty, but we can still help you with repairs. May I please have your contact information so that we can schedule a service appointment?

Customer: (Irritated) I don't care about the warranty\! I need my dishwasher fixed right now\!

# 

# ![][image2]

With this scenario in mind, answer the following questions:

6. Which early verbal escalation signals did you notice in this interaction? Remember, early verbal escalation signals are long pauses, short, clipped phrases, and exasperated sarcastic tone. 

|  |
| :---- |

7. Which late verbal escalation signals did you notice in this interaction? Remember, late indicators are raised voice, use of insults, or crude language. 

|  |
| :---- |

8. What could you say that would mirror the complaint to the customer?

|  |
| :---- |

9. What could you say and do that would narrate the problem-solving method to the customer? Remember to include any call transfers you need to make. 

|  |
| :---- |

10. What could you offer as a reasonable solution to the customer? 

|  |
| :---- |

# 

# ![][image2]

# **Scenario 3**

[Click here to listen to the call recording](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1dTKHx-0CYFGECNLLUnBNbn_D1lvu-nW_/view?usp=share_link) 

Here is the transcript of the scenario:

Agent: Thank you for calling our customer support line. How may I assist you today?

Customer: Yes, I need to return a pair of shoes that I bought from your company. They're really expensive, and I can't wear them because they hurt my feet.

Agent: I'm sorry to hear that the shoes are causing you discomfort. May I please have your name and the order number or purchase date of the shoes to better assist you?

Customer: My name is David Johnson, and I bought the shoes about six months ago. I don't have the order number anymore.

Agent: I see. Unfortunately, our company's policy states that we only accept returns within 30 days of the purchase date, and it has been six months since you purchased the shoes. I apologize for any inconvenience this may cause.

Customer: (Angry) What do you mean you can't accept the return? These shoes were really expensive, and I can't wear them because they hurt my feet\!

Agent: I understand your frustration, Mr. Johnson, but our policy is in place to ensure fair and consistent returns for all of our customers. If the shoes are defective or have a manufacturing issue, we can offer an exchange or repair. However, since it has been over 30 days since you purchased the shoes and they are not defective, we cannot accept the return.

Customer: (Demanding) I want to speak to your manager. This is unacceptable customer service. 

# ![][image2]

With this scenario in mind, answer the following questions:

11. Which early verbal escalation signals did you notice in this interaction? Remember, early verbal escalation signals are long pauses, short, clipped phrases, and exasperated sarcastic tone. 

|  |
| :---- |

12. Which late verbal escalation signals did you notice in this interaction? Remember, late indicators are raised voice, use of insults, or crude language. 

|  |
| :---- |

13. What could you say that would mirror the complaint to the customer?

|  |
| :---- |

14. What could you say and do that would narrate the problem-solving method to the customer? Remember to include any call transfers you need to make. 

|  |
| :---- |

15. What could you offer as a reasonable solution to the customer? 

|  |
| :---- |
